intro: Erigeron leucophyllus, commonly known as the whiteleaf fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in the summer months. Erigeron leucophyllus is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
